subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Runes: Writing as Magic
description: A quick win: understand Runes: Writing as Magic.

hook.text: Odin hung from a tree for nine days and nights to learn the runes. In Norse belief, writing itself was a divine gift.

buildup.text: Runes were the Norse alphabet, but they were also magical symbols used for divination, protection, and curses.

discovery.text: Each rune had a name and meaning beyond its sound. Carving a rune invoked its power. Literacy was sorcery.

twist.text: The Nazis stole Norse runes for propaganda. The SS symbol uses two runes. Fascism corrupted an ancient alphabet.

climax.text: Runes show that literacy was once sacred. We've forgotten that writing was humanity's first technology of power.

punchline.text: Writing was once magic. Odin suffered nine days to learn the runes.

quiz.question: What were runes used for besides writing?
